alert.note: Alert for Baker; Berrien; Brooks; Colquitt; Cook; Decatur; Dougherty; Grady; Lanier; Lowndes; Miller; Mitchell; Seminole; Thomas; Tift; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Walton and northern Bay Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, Gadsden County in Big Bend of Florida, southeastern Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida, northern Jefferson and northern Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida, Washington County in the Panhandle of Florida, central Leon County in Big Bend of Florida, Jackson and Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, Lanier County in south central Georgia, Seminole County in southwestern Georgia, southern Tift and southern Worth Counties in south central Georgia, Decatur and Grady Counties in southwestern Georgia, Berrien County in south central Georgia, Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia, Lowndes, Colquitt and Cook Counties in south central Georgia, southeastern Miller, southeastern Dougherty and central Baker Counties in southwestern Georgia, Thomas and Brooks Counties in south central Georgia through 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/... At 201 PM EDT/101 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Doerun to 8 miles northwest of Chattahoochee to near Eglin Air Force Base. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Monticello, Vernon, Nashville, Adel, Quincy, Havana, Lakeland, Pelham, Marianna, Bainbridge, Midway, Quitman, Florida State University, Tallahassee Community College, Moultrie, Thomasville, Blountstown, Chipley and Valdosta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and south central and southwestern Georgia.
